# `gg`

> [!IMPORTANT]
> This tool is still a POC so expect rough edges. ðŸ˜…

`gg` is a light **software architecture simulator** for documentation and presentation purposes.

It aims to help you define any kind of software architecture and produce step-by-step presentations of various usage scenarios.

Visit **https://gg-charts.com** to start building!

![preview](./screenshot.gif)

([play me](https://gg-charts.com/viewer.html#autoplay=true&))
([edit me](https://gg-charts.com/#autoplay=true&))

## Examples

- [The architecture of this app](https://gg-charts.com/viewer.html#)
- [How Redux works](https://gg-charts.com/viewer.html/#) (inspired by [their documentation](https://redux.js.org/tutorials/fundamentals/part-2-concepts-data-flow#redux-application-data-flow))

## Roadmap

The upcoming features of `gg` are available in **[the roadmap to v1](https://github.com/jodigiordano/gg/milestone/1)**.

Do not hesitate to [create an issue](https://github.com/jodigiordano/gg/issues) for feature requests, bugs, etc.

## Usage

> [!IMPORTANT]
> More ways to use `gg` are planned. For example, a standalone NPM package.

### Embed in a `iframe`

You can embed `gg` as follow:

```html
<iframe
  width="640"
  height="480"
  src="https://gg-charts.com/viewer.html#autoplay=true&">
</iframe>
```

## Development

1. Clone this repository.
2. Run:

```sh
npm install
npm run dev
```
